alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 3:30PM MDT until September 10 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, Colfax and Mora. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms several miles west of Rayado on the far northwest periphery of the Cooks Peak burn scar. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1.0 and 2.0 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ocate Creek, Alona Creek, LeFebres Creek, Bonito Creek, Moras Creek, Sweetwater Creek, Wheaten Creek, Rayado Creek, Banderitas Creek and LaMaquina Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Colfax and North Central Mora Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cook`s Peak fire burn area.
